meanings.definition: To number the pages of (a book, document, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She paginates the book to make it easier to find specific pages.
meanings.sent2: The librarian paginates each new book that comes into the library.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to paginate the clouds in the sky, but they kept changing shape.
meanings.sent4: His mind paginates memories like a meticulous librarian organizing a vast collection.
meanings.sent5: The computer program paginates the online articles automatically for better readability.

meanings.sent1: The printer paginates the report before sending it to the client.
meanings.sent2: It is important to paginate the manuscript correctly before publishing it.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to paginate the recipe book into chapters based on different cuisines.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts paginate like chapters in a never-ending story.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to paginate their essays to make them more organized.
